required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of LM-102 in Patients With Advance Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II, Open-Label, Multiple Center Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Immunogenicity and Preliminary Efficacy of LM-102 Monotherapy or Combination Therapy in Patients With CLDN18.2-Positive Advanced Solid Tumors

collaborator.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Harbin Medical University
First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open label Phase I/II trial of LM-102 injection, a recombinant humanized monoclonal antibody targeting Claudin 18.2 (CLDN18.2). It is being tested in advanced solid tumors including gastric cancer/gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma, Pancreatic Cancer, Biliary Tract Cancer, esophageal adenocarcinoma and ovarian mucous carcinoma.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence and case number of DLT (Dose Limiting Toxicity) during observation period
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 21 days following first dose
primary_outcome.description: DLT is short for Dose Limiting Toxicity. dose-limiting describes side effects of a drug or other treatment that are serious enough to prevent an increase in dose or level of that treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Participant Safety as characterized by frequency and severity of adverse events(according to NCI CTCAE 5.0)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 31 days following last dose or other anti-cancer therapy
primary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 21 days following first dose
primary_outcome.description: The RP2D will be determined during the dose expansion stage of the study. RP2D will be determined using available safety and efficacy data.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 21 days following first dose
primary_outcome.description: The MTD is defined as the dose of which the toxicity rate is lower than the upper bound of EI p_T+ϵ_1= 0.35 and closest to the target toxicity rate of p_T= 0.3 during the DLT observation period (21 days after the first administration in cycle 1 on day 1).

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under plasma concentration vs time curve (AUC) for LM-102
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to finished circle 5 (each cycle is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: changes in AUC over time in participants with LM-102

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to finished circle 5 (each cycle is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is the maximum plasma concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to maximum observed plasma concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to finished circle 5 (each cycle is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax is the time in hrs/days it takes to reach Cmax after dosing with LM-102

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to finished circle 5 (each cycle is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Time for the plasma level of LM-102 to decrease by 1/2 during the terminal elimination phase

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 31 days following last dose
secondary_outcome.description: by measurement of Incidence of anti-drug antibodies (ADA)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 8 months.
through study completion, an average of 8 months.
through study completion, an average of 8 months.

arm_group.description: The dose escalation scheme using the the accelerated titration design for dose 1 and the i3+3 design for the remaining doses. first dose: 3mg/kg, Q3W;
The dose escalation scheme using the the accelerated titration design for dose 1 and the i3+3 design for the remaining doses. Second dose: 10mg/kg, Q3W;
The dose escalation scheme using the the accelerated titration design for dose 1 and the i3+3 design for the remaining doses. Third dose: 20mg/kg, Q3W;
The dose escalation scheme using the the accelerated titration design for dose 1 and the i3+3 design for the remaining doses. Four dose: 30mg/kg, Q3W;
The dose escalation scheme using the the accelerated titration design for dose 1 and the i3+3 design for the remaining doses. Five dose: 40mg/kg, Q3W;

arm_group.arm_group_label: LM-102 (RP2D-1) combined with SOC Dose Escalation
arm_group.description: During the dose escalation of LM-102 combined with SOC,the next lower dose groups (RP2D-1) of LM-102 monotherapy's RP2D will be adopted as the starting dose.

arm_group.arm_group_label: LM-102 (RP2D) combined with SOC Dose Escalation
arm_group.description: During the dose escalation of LM-102 combined with SOC,(If applicable) LM-102 monotherapy's RP2D will be adopted as the starting dose.

intervention.description: LM-102 Injection with dose escalation stage of 3mg/kg up to 40mg/kg, as well as dose expansion stage with recommended dose level from dose escalation stage.
LM-102 Injection with appropriate dose level(s), combined with SOC.
intervention.arm_group_label: LM-102 (RP2D) combined with SOC Dose Escalation
LM-102 (RP2D-1) combined with SOC Dose Escalation
